A complete timeline of Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck's relationship, from their early-2000s romance to their 2025 divorce

By Olivia Singh , Ayomikun Adekaiyero , and Eve Crosbie
Updated 2025-03-25T17:01:33Z
Facebook Email X LinkedIn Copy link Impact Link
Save Saved Read in app
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .
  • Jennifer Lopez filed for divorce from Ben Affleck on the two-year anniversary of their Georgia wedding.
  • The "Gigli" costars originally dated from 2002 to 2004, got back together in 2021 and wed a year later.
  • Their divorce was officially settled and finalized in early 2025.

Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck's rekindled romance seemed like a fairytale when they got married almost 20 years after they split. 

But the dream is over. In August, multiple outlets reported that Lopez filed for divorce in Los Angeles County Superior Court — exactly two years after the pair's lavish wedding in Georgia.

Here's a timeline of their relationship from how they met to where things started to go wrong.

2001: Lopez and Affleck begin filming the movie "Gigli."

Affleck starred as the titular character, a mobster named Larry Gigli, and Lopez portrayed a gangster named Ricki.

Predictably, their characters fell in love and ended up together by the conclusion of the critically panned movie. 

At the time, Lopez was married to Cris Judd, her second husband (she was briefly married to Ojani Noa prior to that). She and Judd met on the set of her music video for "Love Don't Cost a Thing" and wed in September 2001. 

In an interview with Vanity Fair for a feature released in March 2003, Affleck denied speculation that he and Lopez acted romantic with each other while she was married.

"When I met her we became really, really, really good friends," Affleck said.

He continued: "But at first, because she was married, there was no thought of a romantic relationship, so that created the opportunity to get to know each other without any of the falseness that goes with courtship because you're trying to make a good impression."

Affleck said that neither of them changed aspects of themselves, and they "became really good friends in a way that was very comfortable."

"With Jen, I thought, Even though it can never happen, it was nice for me to know I was capable of feeling that way — that I could love somebody in a way where what I really wanted was for them to be happy, even more than I wanted what I wanted," he added. "That was a new experience for me."

April 2002: Ben Affleck takes out ads in Variety and The Hollywood Reporter, in which he gushes about working with Lopez on "Gigli."

Affleck wrote: "You have shown kindness, dedication, diligence, humility, graciousness of spirit, beauty in courage, great empathy, astonishing talent, real poise and true grace...It has been nothing but an honor and a pleasure to work with you. I only wish I were lucky enough to be in all your movies.'' 

He also signed the ad: ''With love, respect and gratitude, Ben Affleck.''

Of the big gesture, Affleck later told Vanity Fair that Lopez "had developed this reputation as a diva and a pain in the ass," and he wanted to publicly voice his support of her and "counteract" that narrative. 

"She works harder than anybody I've ever seen," he said. "I thought I was busy with movies and television and writing; I felt pretty maxed out until I met her. She was doing all that and recording albums on weekends!"

July 2002: Lopez files for divorce from Judd, a month after breakup reports spread. She and Affleck go public with their relationship that summer.

Lopez cited irreconcilable differences as their reason for ending their marriage. 

"Jennifer Lopez and Cris Judd have announced they have resolved all issues arising out of their marriage. The resolution was extremely amicable," their lawyer said in a statement shared by People. 

Affleck told Vanity Fair that he wasn't aware of marital issues between Lopez and Judd because she never mentioned it during their conversations. 

"We would hang out, but I talked about me all the time: 'Enough about you!' I was vaguely aware she had something going on, but I was too busy running off my mouth," he said. 

"It changed when she told me she was getting separated," Affleck said about when things changed between them. "At that point, it became a possibility; doors were opened."

November 5, 2002: Lopez releases her music video for "Jenny From the Block," starring her and Affleck.

The music video drew inspiration from the couple's real-life experience of being scrutinized by the public and being hounded by paparazzi.

It showed them making out on a yacht and holding up a tabloid that included chatter about them. 

That month, Lopez and Affleck are spotted filming their second movie together, "Jersey Girl," in New York City and New Jersey.

The film was directed by Kevin Smith, who later said that he coined the term "Bennifer" — the couple's hybrid nickname. Smith said he gave Lopez and Affleck the moniker "during 'Jersey Girl' pre-production, before the world found out they were dating."

In the movie, Lopez portrayed Affleck's wife who died while giving birth to their daughter. 

November 11, 2002: Their engagement is confirmed during the couple's interview with Diane Sawyer as part of ABC's "PrimeTime: Special Edition."

The couple spilled all the details on Affleck's "traditional" proposal and the custom-made, six-carat pink diamond engagement ring from Harry Winston. 

"It's just a blanket, a quilt of rose petals, all over the whole entire house," Lopez said of the unexpected proposal that took place in Boston. "So many candles, and vases, bouquets. And my song 'Glad' was playing ... I walk in and I was just overwhelmed. I wasn't expecting it, and I was just like 'Oh my God.'"

Lopez said that she began "sobbing" as he read a handwritten letter listing the reasons he loved her and wanted to spend the rest of his life with her. She got even more emotional when she saw the pink diamond, which was her favorite stone.

"I had cried a lot over sadness over the years," she said during the interview. "And for the first time in my life, I cried incredible purging tears of happiness. It was the most cleansing feeling and the most wonderful feeling I had ever had."

The "On the Floor" singer also described Affleck as "brilliantly smart…. Loving. Charming. Affectionate. And I just admire him in every way. I respect him. I feel like he teaches me things." crazy life and needing a sense of security."

November 26, 2002: Lopez's third studio album is released, drawing inspiration from her relationship with Affleck.

"This Is Me... Then" featured tracks like "Jenny From the Block" and "All I Have." The album also included a song called "Dear Ben," which was a love letter to the actor. 

February 9, 2003: The couple attend the LA premiere of Affleck's film "Daredevil."

The event took place at the Village Theatre in Los Angeles and the film was released on February 14.

Affleck also posed on the red carpet with costars Colin Farrell, Michael Clarke Duncan, and Jennifer Garner — who he'd go on to marry.

At the time, Garner was married to "Felicity" costar Scott Foley. Their nuptials took place in October 2000 and Garner filed for divorce in May 2003. Foley later told TV Guide that there was no infidelity involved. 

March 2003: In his Vanity Fair feature, Affleck says that Lopez made him a better person and he's excited to marry her.

"Jennifer is a really wonderful, fabulous woman, smart and interesting," he told the publication. "Spending time with her makes me a better person and a happier person. She impresses me every day. It feels better to me to be with her than without her."

He added: "Jen and I want to get married for the reason everyone else does: we fell in love. I'm in love; I want to have a family; and she's the only person I've ever met who made me entertain the thought of doing that."

The "Gone Girl" star said that he didn't understand the public's obsession with the relationship, but had an idea why people were so interested.

"I think it has to do with race and class, the fact that I'm white and she's Puerto Rican," he said. "That's what's underneath, although nobody says it, because it's not politically correct."

Affleck also said that people made incorrect assumptions about Lopez's romantic life because she was "characterized as oversexed."

"Jen has had fewer boyfriends than your average high-school junior," he said. "In the physical sense, she's extremely chaste."

He added: "She's had a much simpler, more easily explainable, more clean romantic history than I have. She can tell the whole story in 15 minutes, whereas I always preface the whole story with 'It was complicated ...'"

Affleck also said that race was a factor, because "there's a kind of language that's used about her — the spicy Latina, the tempestuous diva. She's characterized as oversexed."

"She's a deeply misunderstood woman, in my opinion," he said. 

July 2003: The couple participates in a joint interview as a couple to promote "Gigli," though many of the questions are about their romance.

During the hourlong "Dateline" NBC special hosted by Pat O'Brien of "Access Hollywood," the couple recalled not really knowing each other prior to working together on "Gigli."

"We met at a couple of the parties," Lopez said. "You know, we barely paid any attention to each other at all."

Lopez insisted that they were "really good friends" on the set of "Gigli."

"We talked a lot and that's the thing," she said. "There was no kind of idea that we would be together in the future, so it was one of those things where you kind of like say too much."

She added: "It felt like we had good chemistry. He likes to improv. I could improv back. He's the best person to improv in the whole entire business, he's so funny."

Lopez also said that there wasn't an exact moment when they fell in love.

"You can't pinpoint it. It was like we became friends first, that is the honest-to-god truth," she said. 

Elsewhere in the interview, the singer said that she'd maintain her surname professionally, but would technically take Affleck's last name.

Affleck, a Boston native and vocal Red Sox fan, also said that he was opposed to their family being supporters of the New York Yankees — the team that originates in Lopez's hometown. 

"The Mets is fine. I could put up with the Mets. The Mets I could live with," he said. "Pinstripes can't be in the house."

August 1, 2003: "Gigli" is released in theaters and famously flops at the box office.

In the years that followed, Lopez spoke about the difficulties that followed. 

"I think the worst, probably lowest point was the whole 'Gigli' era. It was pretty tough," she said in a 2015 interview with "HuffPost Live," according to E! News.

"It was a very badly reviewed film," she elaborated. "I was in a high-profile relationship at the time that fell apart in a really bad way, and so the kind of mix of those two things and the tabloid press had just come into existence at the time, so I was like a poster child for that moment."

She added: "I was in the tabloids every other week about how my life was falling apart. It was a tough time."

Despite the hardships, Lopez said that she had "no regrets."

"I would do it all over again, I think," she said. "I really would. Even the relationship part. "

In an interview with Vanity Fair in 2017, the star said that she was "eviscerated" by that period in her life. 

"I lost my sense of self, questioned if I belonged in this business, thought maybe I did suck at everything," she said. "And my relationship [with Affleck] self-destructed in front of the entire world. It was a two-year thing for me until I picked myself up again."

September 2003: Lopez and Affleck's wedding is postponed because of public attention.

According to People, the couple was supposed to marry in Santa Barbara but pushed it back shortly before the planned date. 

"Due to the excessive media attention surrounding our wedding, we have decided to postpone the date," they said in a statement. "When we found ourselves seriously contemplating hiring three separate 'decoy brides' at three different locations, we realized that something was awry."

They continued: "We began to feel that the spirit of what should have been the happiest day of our lives could be compromised. We felt what should have been a joyful and sacred day could be spoiled for us, our families and our friends."

January 2004: Their split is officially announced.

The announcement wasn't entirely surprising to fans, who noticed that Affleck went solo to events and Lopez was spotted sans her engagement ring. 

"Jennifer Lopez has ended her engagement to Ben Affleck," a rep for the singer said, per People. "At this difficult time, we ask that you respect her privacy."

March 26, 2004: Their film "Jersey Girl" is released in theaters.

While it wasn't as despised by critics as "Gigli," the film still received poor reviews. 

June 5, 2004: Lopez marries Marc Anthony in Los Angeles.

The ceremony took place in her Beverly Hills home and had a small guest list. 

Lopez and Anthony welcomed twins named Max and Emme on February 22, 2008.

In July 2011, the pair revealed their split. 

"This was a very difficult decision," they said in a joint statement. "We have come to an amicable conclusion on all matters. It is a painful time for all involved and we appreciate the respect of our privacy at this time."

June 2005: Affleck marries Garner in a low-key wedding ceremony that takes place in Turks and Caicos.

A few months later, in December 2005, the couple welcomed their first child, a daughter named Violet.

Garner gave birth to two more children: daughter Seraphina in January 2009 and son Samuel in February 2012.

In June 2015, the couple revealed their breakup after being married for a decade.

"After much thought and careful consideration, we have made the difficult decision to divorce," their statement to People read. "We go forward with love and friendship for one another and a commitment to co-parenting our children whose privacy we ask to be respected during this difficult time."

May 3, 2010: During an appearance on "The Graham Norton Show," Lopez says that her relationship with Affleck "did suffer" because of the media's attention.

"I love Ben, he's a great guy, but it was a lot for both of us to be under that type of siege for two years straight," she said. "We were on the cover of every magazine, every week, it was just a weird thing."

Lopez continued: "Our relationship, I think, did suffer because of that. That's not the only reason. I would never blame the media for anything, but I think it definitely played a part in the dynamic of our relationship." 

January 25, 2013: Lopez says that she and Affleck still communicate, mostly via email.

Appearing on Katie Couric's talk show, "Katie," the singer said that it wasn't awkward running into exes Diddy and Affleck at the Golden Globes that year. 

"We run in the same circles," she said. "I do see them. The world doesn't know that I see them. I don't go, 'Hey, I ran into Diddy today.' I don't tweet that kind of stuff. But I do run into them."

"We talk and we email, more email than anything," Lopez added of keeping in touch with Affleck.

Lopez said that she was "happy" for Affleck after his film "Argo," which he directed, produced, and starred in, won two awards at the event: best drama motion picture and best director. 

The singer called the film "one of the best pictures of the year" and said that she gave him a standing ovation when he won.

November 4, 2014: Lopez opens up about her romantic history in her memoir titled "True Love."

"Ben and I split up at the moment when I thought we were committing to each other forever, it was my first real heartbreak, it felt like my heart had been torn out of my chest," she wrote, per Page Six.

Lopez said that she "sought out comfort in another person."

"Marc came back into my life three days after I should have been at the altar saying 'I do' to another man," she wrote. 

March 2016: Lopez says that she and Affleck had "genuine love" for each other.

"We didn't try to have a public relationship," she said in an interview with Jess Cagle, the editorial director at People and Entertainment Weekly. "We just happened to be together at the birth of the tabloids, and it was like 'Oh my God.' It was just a lot of pressure."

She added: "I think different time different thing, who knows what could've happened, but there was a genuine love there." 

January 2019: Lopez says that tabloid attention "absolutely" led to their breakup.

"When the tabloids were out and we were being hounded by paparazzi constantly, it was a really hard time," she said during part one of her documentary for MTV called "The Ride."

"I remember being on the cover of those tabloids for two years straight and it was brutal," she added. "I think it absolutely contributed to the demise of our relationship and the love that we had. There was so much judgment and pressure and scrutiny and opinions and it was just a really, really hard thing to deal with."

She shared similar thoughts months later during an interview with "CBS This Morning," in which she said that the media attention was "scary" and "overwhelming" for her and Affleck. 

February 18, 2020: Affleck says that Lopez should have been nominated for an Oscar for her performance in "Hustlers."

He praised his ex during an interview with The New York Times, but the quotes never made it into the feature. The reporter, Brooks Barnes, shared the comment in a thread on X (formerly known as Twitter) with other quotes that didn't make the cut. 

"She should have been nominated," Affleck said. "She's the real thing. I keep in touch periodically with her and have a lot of respect for her. How awesome is it that she had her biggest hit movie at 50? That's fucking baller."  

January 4, 2021: Affleck says that people said sexist and racist things about Lopez that wouldn't be acceptable today.

"People were so fucking mean about her — sexist, racist," he said during The Hollywood Reporter's "Awards Chatter" podcast. "Ugly, vicious shit was written about her in ways that if you wrote it now you would literally be fired for saying those things you said."

Affleck said that nowadays, Lopez is more respected for her achievements.

"I would say you have a better shot, coming from the Bronx, of ending up as [Justice Sonia] Sotomayor on the Supreme Court than you do of having Jennifer Lopez's career and being who she is at 50 years old today," he said. 

January 18, 2021: Multiple outlets report that Affleck and "Knives Out" star Ana de Armas broke up after dating for less than a year.

People and E! News were among the publications that reported the breakup in January 2021. According to a source who spoke to People, de Armas ended the relationship.

The two stars met while filming the upcoming psychological thriller "Deep Water" in New Orleans, Louisiana, in 2019. 

Throughout the pandemic, they were frequently photographed while going on walks together in LA. The "Blonde" star also spent time with Affleck's kids whom he shares with Garner.

De Armas made their relationship Instagram official in April 2020 when she posted a photo of the "Justice League" star with his arms around her waist, celebrating her 32nd birthday. 

After their breakup was revealed, paparazzi saw a life-size cutout of de Armas being thrown in Affleck's trash bin. The same one was previously seen on Affleck's lawn in June 2020, seemingly as part of a prank that his kids pulled on him. 

April 5, 2021: Affleck speaks about Lopez's work ethic and agelessness in her May 2021 cover story for InStyle.

Affleck was one of several friends and costars of Lopez who spoke highly of the entertainer. 

"I thought I had a good work ethic, but I was completely humbled and blown away by what she was committed to doing day in and day out, the seriousness in which she took her work, the quiet and dedicated way she went about accomplishing her goals, and then how she would go back and redouble her efforts," Affleck said.

The actor continued: "She remains, to this day, the hardest-working person I've come across in this business. She has great talent, but she has also worked very hard for her success, and I'm so happy for her that she seems, at long last, to be getting the credit she deserves."

Joking about the singer seemingly being ageless, Affleck said, "Where are you keeping the fountain of youth? Why do you look the same as you did in 2003 and it kind of looks like I'm in my 40s…at best?"

April 15, 2021: Lopez and Alex Rodriguez confirm that they split up after four years together.

Page Six was the first to report their breakup in March, citing an anonymous source.

The breakup was also confirmed by TMZ, E! News, and People. A source told People that the split "has been a long time coming" for the two stars.

The following day, the couple shared a joint statement with People, saying: "We are working through some things."

In April, they announced the end of their relationship and two-year engagement via a joint statement to the "Today" show.

"We have realized we are better as friends and look forward to remaining so," they said. "We will continue to work together and support each other on our shared businesses and projects. We wish the best for each other and one another's children. Out of respect for them, the only other comment we have to say is thank you to everyone who has sent kind words and support."

April 30, 2021: Page Six reports that Lopez and Affleck are spending time together at her LA home.

According to the publication, Affleck was "picked up in a white Escalade SUV that allegedly belongs to Lopez and then taken to her nearby mansion." 

Anonymous sources that spoke to People and E! News said that Lopez and Affleck were just friends. 

"They have a great time hanging out," a source told People a few days after photos were first published of the two stars in separate vehicles. "It's been years since they caught up properly. They have lots to talk about."

Affleck and Lopez also participated in Global Citizen's "Vax Live: The Concert to Reunite the World," which aired on Saturday, May 2. Lopez performed, while Affleck spoke on stage with Jimmy Kimmel. The two weren't photographed together at the taping, which took place in California. 

May 10, 2021: People magazine reports that they "spent several days" together in Montana.

"They have a strong connection. It's all been quick and intense, but Jennifer is happy," an anonymous source told People.

Daily Mail published photographs of Lopez and Affleck in a car together in Montana, with the "Good Will Hunting" actor driving. The publication reported that Affleck owns a home in Big Sky. 

According to a source that spoke to E! News, Lopez and Affleck spent about a week in Yellowstone Club in Montana, "just the two of them."

Another source also told the publication that Affleck reached out to Lopez "to see how she was doing and they had dinner together a few times within this last month."

"They picked up where they last left off and are enjoying each other's company right now," the source said. 

People went on to report that Lopez was in contact with the actor prior to her breakup with Rodriguez, but "it was friendly conversations" and she didn't meet up with Affleck until her relationship ended. 

The publication also said that it was Affleck's idea for them to go on a trip outside LA. 

Amid dating speculation, Matt Damon, Affleck's longtime best friend and collaborator, weighed in and told the "Today" show: "I hope it's true. I love them both. I hope it's true. That would be awesome."

May 23, 2021: The stars spend time together in Miami.

They were photographed descending a staircase together and a source told E! News that Affleck "took a red-eye to Miami and went straight to J.Lo's new house in the early morning hours. She looked very happy to see him and they walked around the property together so she could show him around."

Fans also speculated that Affleck had started re-wearing a watch that he often sported when he and Lopez previously dated. 

The following day, they were photographed going to a gym. They were also seen on the balcony of the "On the Floor" singer's rental home in Miami. 

A source later told Us Weekly that they were full-on dating, though neither star commented on the reports.

"Jen and Ben are both very happy with each [other] and are excited to see where the relationship goes," an anonymous source told the publication. "They are full-on dating and very happy together."

According to Page Six, Lopez and Affleck "planned to announce their reunion in a more tightly controlled" prior to the initial photos circulated showing him reportedly visiting her house.

A source told Page Six that Lopez was originally "planning to make an announcement that they are back together on Instagram."

June 1, 2021: They're photographed with their arms around each other in California.

Photos obtained by Page Six showed the stars walking close together as they headed to chef Wolfgang Puck's new restaurant at the Pendry Hotel located in West Hollywood.

Days later, Affleck was photographed smiling at the paparazzi as he left Lopez's home in a vehicle.  

E! News and other publications reported that Lopez was looking into moving from Miami to LA and considering schools there for her twins to attend in the fall. 

In early June, Affleck was also seen spending time at a casino in Nevada with Lopez's mom, Guadalupe Rodríguez. 

"They enjoy gambling together and have done it in the past," a source told E! News. "Ben had the opportunity to work in Vegas this week and she came out."

June 14, 2021: Photos obtained by Page Six show Lopez and Affleck kissing.

Photos and a video published by the publication showed the two stars kissing, leaning in close, and talking with each other at a table.

According to Page Six, Lopez and Affleck were having dinner at Nobu in Malibu on June 13. They were reportedly at the restaurant with Lopez's twins to celebrate the birthday of the "Hustler" star's sister, Lynda Lopez. 

Photos of their PDA came a few days after Lopez was spotted seemingly wearing a flannel shirt that Affleck was previously photographed in. 

They continue to be photographed in public together.

In photos published by Page Six, they were seen at Universal Studios Hollywood on July 2 with their kids from previous relationships.

The following day, Lopez and Affleck were photographed with their arms wrapped around each other while walking in the Hamptons. They were later seen shopping with Lopez's kids in the Hamptons.

Not long after, Lopez liked a photo posted by a fan account on Instagram called @lopezaffleck, which showed Affleck on the set of the 2010 movie "The Town."

The "Argo" star was also photographed spending time at Universal CityWalk in Universal City, California with his kids and Lopez's daughter named Emme. 

July 22, 2021: Leah Remini posts a photo of the couple in attendance at her 51st birthday celebration days prior.

A video recap shared by Remini included a photo of herself and Lopez hugging Affleck. Lopez also had her hand placed on the actor's chest as he posed in the middle.

July 24, 2021: Lopez makes their rekindled relationship Instagram-official on her 52nd birthday.

The singer posted a series of photos of herself in a swimsuit on her X and Instagram. 

"5 2 … what it do …💗 📸: @lacarba," she captioned the post. The final photo in Lopez's Instagram post showed her and Affleck kissing. 

Fans also noticed that the framed black-and-white image in the background of one of her birthday photos is the same snap of her and Affleck that was taken for his 2003 Vanity Fair feature. 

In addition, the couple celebrated Lopez's birthday with a party at L'Opera in St. Tropez, France. A video from the festivities showed Lopez singing along to her track "Jenny From the Block," whose music video starred Affleck, as waiters danced on the tables.

They were also seen seemingly recreating a famous moment from the "Jenny From the Block" music video, in which Affleck put his hand on Lopez's butt while on a yacht. Some fans have even speculated that the stars are recreating scenes for the music video's upcoming 20th anniversary next year.

Beth Bugdaycay, the creative director and cofounder of Foundrae, told E! News that Affleck designed custom jewelry to gift Lopez for her birthday.

Paparazzi photos taken of Lopez shortly after her birthday showed the singer wearing a gold necklace that spelled "BEN."

After spending time in St. Tropez, the stars were seen dining at a restaurant in Capri, Italy and walking hand-in-hand. 

August 23, 2021: Affleck is photographed browsing at Tiffany's in Century City, California.

Photos published by Page Six showed the actor shopping with his mother and his son. 

An anonymous source told E! News that Affleck wasn't in search of an engagement ring for Lopez. instead, he was reportedly making a stop at the jewelry store as part of a scavenger hunt with his kids.

September 10, 2021: The couple returns to the red carpet for the first time since getting back together.

Lopez accompanied Affleck to the premiere of his upcoming film "The Last Duel" at the Venice Film Festival. The stars laughed, smiled, held hands, and kissed during their first red carpet appearance in 18 years.

September 13, 2021: Affleck and Lopez attend the Met Gala together.

Lopez walked the carpet solo in a Western-themed outfit from Ralph Lauren, but Affleck posed beside her for photos later at the event. They also kissed while wearing masks.

September 16, 2021: Lopez praises Affleck's work in his film "The Last Duel."

The singer posted a video on social media, recapping her trip to Venice with Affleck.

Lopez wrote: "I had such a beautiful time!! And I'm so excited for you guys to see this movie!! It's the first script Matt and Ben have written together along with Nicole Holofcener since Good Will Hunting!! And it's amazing!! The acting by the whole cast is fantastic. Jodie Comer plays the lead and she is awesome!!! It was a magical trip and I hope you enjoy the pics!!"

September 2021: Affleck praises Lopez's "effect on the world" as a woman of color.

"All I can tell you is that I have seen firsthand the difference representation makes because I have seen, over and over and over and over, women of color approach Jennifer and tell her what her example as a strong woman and a woman succeeding and demanding her fair share in the business world means to them," Affleck said in an interview with AdWeek as part of a feature on Lopez.

He continued: "I am in awe of what Jennifer's effect on the world is. At most, as an artist, I can make movies that move people. Jennifer has inspired a massive group of people to feel they have a seat at the table in this country. That is an effect few people throughout history have had, one I will never know and one I can only stand by and admire with respect."

September 25, 2021: Affleck accompanies Lopez to the Global Citizen Live event in New York City, where she performs.

They were seen holding hands at the event, where Lopez sang her hits like "Jenny From the Block" and "Love Don't Cost a Thing." 

"Ben wanted to be by her side and attended the event. He watched her perform," a source told People. 

​​"She's been working hard, and it meant a lot to her to have him there," an anonymous Insider told E! News. "She was excited to spend the weekend with him. They went to dinner after the show and had some fun."

The following day, paparazzi photographed them smiling while walking hand-in-hand through Madison Square Park in NYC. Additional photos posted by Entertainment Tonight and People showed the couple kissing while standing on a sidewalk. 

October 9, 2021: Lopez and Affleck attend the NYC premiere of "The Last Duel" at Lincoln Center.

Affleck wore a black velvet suit and Lopez chose a sparkling brown two-piece outfit. 

November 2021: They reportedly spend Thanksgiving together.

An anonymous source told People that Lopez traveled from Vancouver, where she was filming a Netflix movie "The Mother," to LA to spend the holiday with Affleck and her children. 

"The last few weeks have been intense for her," the source said, adding that it was difficult for Lopez to be away from her loved ones while filming in Canada. 

Affleck also reportedly spent time with ex-wife Garner and their three kids.

Her ninth studio album included songs like "Dear Ben Pt. II," a followup to a track from her album "This Is Me… Then" about her relationship with Affleck.

"Things that are private I always felt are sacred and special because, in part, they're private," Affleck said in the documentary. "So this was something of an adjustment for me."

"I did really find the beauty and the poetry and the irony in the fact that it's the greatest love story never told," Affleck said. "If you're making a record about it, that seems kind of like telling it."

TMZ also reported, citing the document, that Lopez listed the separation as April 26, before rumors about their split began to circulate.

Paparazzi snapped photos of the two stars meeting for lunch in Beverly Hills with Affleck's kids, Seraphina and Samuel, and Lopez's twins, Max and Emme. This marked Lopez and Affleck's first appearance together since she filed for divorce. 

According to a source who spoke to Page Six and claimed to be present during the reunion, Lopez and Affleck were "holding hands and kissing" at the Polo Lounge. The source added that the kids were "at a separate table."

However, a source told People that the meet-up was just friendly.

"They all came together for a fun lunch so the kids could hang out," the source said, adding that the stars are continuing divorce proceedings and "working out financial details amicably." 

"A divorce is never easy, but Jennifer doesn't want to be selfish about it," the source added. "The kids always got along and have fun together. It makes her happy seeing the kids happy together. Happy kids are her priority."

January 6, 2025: Lopez and Affleck settle their divorce.

About four months after Lopez filed for a dissolution of their two-year marriage, the couple settled their divorce in early 2025.

According to court documents obtained by multiple outlets, there was no request for spousal support by either party and the pair settled the divorce through mediation.

February 21, 2025: The former couple's divorce is finalized, concluding their relationship.

The divorce was made final after a monthslong legal process.

The Associated Press reported that following the decision by a Los Angeles Superior Court judge to approve their divorce settlement on January 6, their marriage was dissolved on February 21.

The pair are now legally single and Lopez will drop 'Affleck' from her last name, according to court documents.

While most of the financial details of their separation have been kept private, according to documents obtained by People on January 29, the former couple will share the profit they obtain from their Beverly Hills, California mansion once it has sold.

March 25, 2025: Affleck tells GQ there's "no scandal, no soap opera, no intrigue" regarding his and Lopez's breakup.

In a wide-ranging interview with GQ, Affleck spoke about his divorce from Lopez for the first time.

Speaking specifically about his appearance in Lopez's documentary, "The Greatest Love Story Never Told," Affleck said that although he's "a little bit more reserved and private" than Lopez, the documentary showed him reconciling with their different approaches to fame while still being loving and supportive of her.

"I think it's important to say that wasn't the cause of some major fracture," Affleck said. "It's not like you can watch that documentary and go, "Oh, now I understand the issues that these two had."

In a follow-up interview, Affleck made it clear that Lopez "is somebody I have a lot of respect for."

He also said that he understands the tendency for people to try to pinpoint specific causes of a breakup, but there was no final nail in the coffin when it came to his relationship with Lopez.

"There's no scandal, no soap opera, no intrigue," he said.
